text: Which of the following are typical approaches taken to sourcing IT talent? (Select all that apply).

Deloitte research has identified a number of key approaches to attracting and retaining expert staff. Select the top three reasons that were identified.
Correct Answer

answers.answer_text: Be recognised as a good employer
Allow employers to have dinner with the boss

text: Which of the following is the greatest obstacle to the success of most major change projects.
Match the group of people with the role they play in supporting management of change.

answers.matching: Coaching the people who report to them
Integrating the people side of change

matching_list: Coaching the people who report to them
Integrating the people side of change

text: Which of the following are key perspectives of ADKAR. (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Employees go through the change process in stages and go through these stages as individuals
Value systems have a direct impact on how employees react to change
Change agents must be conscious of both a senders’ mentality and the receivers’ orientation
The “right” answer is not enough to successfully implement change
Employee resistance is the norm, not the exception. Expect some to never support the change
Once you convince the early adopters to change, the others will follow
The size of the change determines how much and what kind of change management is needed
Visible and active sponsorship is not only desirable but necessary for success
It is important to try to get everyone to move through change together
It is important to slow down if change isn't working

text: The reading (Forming project teams – the right mix is key to success) referred to Tuckman's five stages, and this was then explained further in reading 4 (5 Stages of a Team Development Tuckman | Better Explained). One of the five stages is storming, where a team has problems. Which of the following are identified as ways of dealing with these problems? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Always give work to the person who is most capable
Fire anyone who is a troublemaker
Only allocate work to people who are keen to do it
Define tasks clearly within individuals domains

text: According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management), which of the following are major barriers to project teams development? (Select all that apply).

According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management) suggestions for effectively managing the barrier of 'Differing Outlooks, Priorities, Interests and Judgements of Team Members' are? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Fully explain the scope of the project and the rewards.
Make effort early in the project life cycle to discover these conflicting differences.
Try to blend individual interests with the overall project objectives.
Ask team members where they see themselves fitting into the project.

text: According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management) what are some characteristics of an effective project team? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: High Interest in the Team and Team Processes

text: According to the reading (Team Building in Project Management) what are some characteristics of an ineffective project team? (Select all that apply).

answers.answer_text: Professional Objectives of Team Members Coincides with Project Requirements
Team Members Operate Independently/ Lack of Coordination

text: According to the reading (5 Stages of a Team Development Tuckman | Better Explained) match the five stages of team development to the description that best describes what occurs in the stage.

answers.matching: This is the stage in which the team members meet for the very first time and are excited, positive and polite towards one another.
This is the stage in which the team's effectiveness drops drastically and where most teams fail. This is where the team members need to discuss skills, background etc.
This is the stage in which team effectiveness should go up exponentially. In this stage team members ask each other for help, provide constructive feedback etc.
This is the stage in which team members find it easy to be a part of the team, you can easily accomodate new people and start to focus on other goals and areas of work.
This is the stage in which the teams are disbanded and most people will need to find new opportunities.

matching_list: This is the stage in which the teams are disbanded and most people will need to find new opportunities.
This is the stage in which the team's effectiveness drops drastically and where most teams fail. This is where the team members need to discuss skills, background etc.
This is the stage in which the team members meet for the very first time and are excited, positive and polite towards one another.
This is the stage in which team effectiveness should go up exponentially. In this stage team members ask each other for help, provide constructive feedback etc.
This is the stage in which team members find it easy to be a part of the team, you can easily accomodate new people and start to focus on other goals and areas of work.

text: According to the reading(Project Failure: Top 10 Reasons Why Projects Fail) what are some of the top reasons why a project fails? (Select all that apply).
According to the reading (Critical success factors in project management. To fail or not to fail, that is the question!) what are some of the factors that substantially influence project success?

answers.answer_text: The change in the company environment.

text: According to the reading (Critical success factors in project management. To fail or not to fail, that is the question!) (Links to an external site.) what are some of the factors that have a small influence on project success?

answers.answer_text: Periodically meeting of the steering commitee.

text: Which 3 steps from John Kotter's 8 step change model are focused on "Creating a climate for change"? (Select all that are applicable)
